name: tlock
description: Timelock Encryption made practical. The Go `tlock` library and the `tle` cmd line tool home to encrypt towards the future.
readme_summary: The tlock Go library and `tle` CLI tool enable practical timelock encryption, allowing data to be encrypted today but only decrypted at a future, predetermined time. It leverages the drand threshold network for secure and verifiable time-based decryption keys.
key_features: Relies on drand threshold network for future decryption
Support for mainnet and testnet drand chains
primary_use_case: Encrypting data that can only be decrypted after a specific future round on the drand network, ensuring future access without relying on a single party's availability.
cover_image_prompt: A futuristic vault door with a complex, glowing lock mechanism. Instead of a traditional keyhole, the lock has a digital display showing a countdown timer and a series of interconnected nodes representing the drand network. A beam of light is attempting to unlock the vault, but it's blocked by a temporal barrier, indicating the data is locked until a future time. Subtle digital particles and code snippets float around the scene, hinting at the cryptographic nature. The overall mood is secure and forward-looking, rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style with a cool, technological color palette.

name: browsr
description: üóÇÔ∏è a pleasant file explorer in your terminal supporting all filesystems
readme_summary: Browsr is a terminal-based file explorer that allows users to navigate and interact with local and remote file systems. It supports various cloud storage services and offers features like syntax highlighting, JSON formatting, and data table rendering.
key_features: Supports local and remote file systems
Integrates with GitHub, SSH, AWS S3, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob Storage
Data file conversion to navigable datatables
primary_use_case: Navigating and exploring local and remote file systems directly from the terminal with a rich user interface.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly, anthropomorphic file cabinet with a glowing screen on its front, standing in a digital landscape. The file cabinet is actively opening drawers, revealing not just paper files, but also glowing icons representing cloud services (S3, GitHub, SSH) and data visualizations. A small, stylized cursor hovers over one of the drawers, indicating interaction. Subtle lines of code flow around the base of the cabinet, connecting it to the digital environment. The overall mood is helpful and organized, with a clean, modern aesthetic. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with soft, ambient lighting and a palette of blues, greens, and grays.

name: relay
description: ‚úâÔ∏è Open-Source Email API for Developers. Self-hosted Alternative to SES, Mailgun, SendGrid.
readme_summary: Hyvor Relay is an open-source, self-hosted email API that allows developers to send emails using their own infrastructure. It provides a robust alternative to commercial email services like SES, Mailgun, and SendGrid, offering features for managing deliverability, logs, and multi-tenancy.
key_features: Health checks for performance and deliverability
Queues for transactional and distributional emails
Automatic greylisting, retries, and bounce handling
Feedback loop integration and suppression management
Observability with Prometheus, Grafana, and logs
primary_use_case: To provide developers with a self-hosted, open-source email sending API that offers control over infrastructure and data, serving as a cost-effective and customizable alternative to cloud-based email services.
cover_image_prompt: A stylized, open-source mailbox made of digital building blocks, with a friendly robot arm carefully placing letters (representing emails) into it. The mailbox is connected by glowing data streams to various digital devices (laptops, phones) representing developers. Subtle UI elements showing email sending status and logs appear on small screens integrated into the scene. The background is a clean, modern digital landscape with a soft, inviting glow. The overall mood is one of reliable, automated delivery and developer empowerment. The art style should be a 3D isometric illustration with a vibrant, tech-focused color palette.

name: coralnpu
description: A machine learning accelerator core designed for energy-efficient AI at the edge.
readme_summary: Coral NPU is an open-source, energy-efficient hardware accelerator IP designed for machine learning inference, particularly for ultra-low-power edge devices like wearables. It is based on the RISC-V ISA and features specialized matrix, vector, and scalar processing units.
key_features: Four-stage processor, in-order dispatch, out-of-order retire
8 KB ITCM and 32 KB DTCM memories
primary_use_case: Energy-efficient machine learning inference acceleration for ultra-low-power edge devices.
cover_image_prompt: A miniature, highly detailed AI chip, resembling a tiny, intricate city, humming with energy. From one side, streams of raw data, depicted as glowing, abstract particles, flow into the city. Within the city, specialized 'districts' (matrix, vector, scalar processors) efficiently process these particles. On the other side, the processed data emerges as clear, insightful 'knowledge' icons (like a lightbulb, a checkmark, or a simplified image recognition symbol) flowing out to power small, futuristic wearable devices like smartwatches and AR glasses. The overall scene is clean, bright, and futuristic, with subtle circuit board patterns in the background. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with a vibrant, yet focused color palette, emphasizing efficiency and intelligence.

name: nanobrowser
description: Open-Source Chrome extension for AI-powered web automation. Run multi-agent workflows using your own LLM API key. Alternative to OpenAI Operator.
readme_summary: Nanobrowser is an open-source Chrome extension that enables AI-powered web automation through multi-agent workflows. It acts as a privacy-focused, free alternative to tools like OpenAI Operator, allowing users to leverage their own LLM API keys for flexible and transparent browser automation.
primary_use_case: AI-powered web automation and multi-agent workflows directly within the browser.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled conductor leading an orchestra of diverse AI agents, each represented by a unique, stylized robot or creature. The conductor, holding a digital baton, directs them to interact with a complex, stylized cityscape representing the internet. Each agent is shown performing a specific task: one navigates a website (visualized as a building), another analyzes data (represented by glowing streams of information), and a third communicates findings (shown as digital messages). Subtle UI elements and data particles flow between them, indicating seamless collaboration. The Nanobrowser logo is subtly integrated into the conductor's podium. The scene is a vibrant, 3D isometric illustration with a clean, futuristic aesthetic and a bright, optimistic color palette.
